definition: can't judge true or false (idiom); unable to distinguish the genuine from the fake/not to know whether to believe (what one reads in the news)
really/truly/indeed/real/true/genuine
variant of 偽|伪[wei3]
false/fake/forged/bogus/(prefix) pseudo-/Taiwan pr. [wei4]
do not/there is none who
surname Mo
to distinguish/to recognize
hard to distinguish real from imitation
what is true and what is fake
apparently right but actually wrong; specious (idiom)
facing a wall, an imaginary construction (idiom); baseless fabrication
to pass off fish eyes for pearls/to pass off fake products as genuine (idiom)
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
three men talking makes a tiger (idiom); repeated rumor becomes a fact
unable to reach a decision (idiom); cannot agree on the right choice/no unanimous decision/still a matter of discussion
lit. public opinion is powerful enough to melt metal (idiom)/fig. public clamor can obscure the actual truth/mass spreading of rumors can confuse right and wrong
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to spread falsehoods/to increasingly distort the truth/to pile errors on top of errors (idiom)
hyperbole/exaggeration
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
diverse and muddled/many and confused
genuine or fake/true or false
